repnme.cdata!:
Togo, Cote d'Ivoire, Ghana - CIMAO
            Regional Clinker Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Cimao Regional Clinker Project
            includes two complementary components: (a) an industrial
            complex comprising a dry clinker plant of an annual capacity
            of 1.2 million tons to be built at Tabligbo, about 65 km
            northeast of Lome; it will comprise the quarry, two clinker
            production lines, storage and rail facilities. (b) related
            infrastructure comprising: a railway line of about 80 km to
            connect the plant with the port of Lome, and railroad
            equipment; a rail/port terminal within the port of Lome; a
            power link and sub-station connecting the plant to the
            existing network; and a township. The project will provide
            for: (i) management and technical assistance to help CIMAO
            to achieve full capacity utilization rapidly; (ii) addition
            quarry equipment to prevent quarry operations from becoming
            a bottleneck (iii) spare parts and equipment to permit full
            plant operations and the carrying out of an adequate
            maintenance program; (iv) financing of fuel and (v)
            restoration of working capital to a healthy level. The
            project restores CIMAO's financial viability through
            provision of equity from shareholder Governments and
            long-term financing. Governments have agreed to set
            CIMAO's clinker prices according to an agreed price
            schedule until 1983 and will review prices periodically
            thereafter to maintain financial viability in the future.
            The restructuring measures are designed to help the company
            to reduce gradually clinker prices thereafter.
